website_summaries.verdict: A cute, comfortable shoe that works well as an everyday practice shoe but tends to run small.
pros: Customers love the adorable style and comfort that this shoe provides and praise it for being a good shoe for the price
They are also soft and lightweight
cons: Tends to run small, and some don't like the canvas fabric or feel it is too stiff
Some inconsistencies in quality suggest quality control could be improved

customer_reviews.title: ORDER A SIZE UP
customer_reviews.text: I should have ordered a size up but my 3 year old was just starting ballet. I had boys before her. I've never been in ballet so I probably should've done more research. I thought I could just buy her her normal shoe size but I was wrong. They were too tight. After some time, I was able to get them on her but I'm sure it wasn't comfortable for her. Next time, I will order at least a half size larger.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Ballet Slippers for the Prima
customer_reviews.text: When we needed ballet slippers for my 6-year old, we ordered these. Using the sizing instructions on the product page, we obtained a perfectly sized pair of split sole ballet shoes/slippers that my daughter loved, and her ballet instructor was both impressed with and impressed with the price of!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan McG

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for beginning Irish Dance classes and Gymnastics for 4-year old child. A little long, but that's on me for not measuring the foot. And since we have 3 months before class starts, she'll grow into the shoes. Stitching is sturdy, split leather sole provides traction, elastic draw strings provide tightening..
customer_reviews.author: Euro

customer_reviews.title: Size was perfect 8-9 for 2 year old
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old daughter wears a 8-9 and this fit her perfectly. She loves them- she said they hurt her toes a little, but I guess that’s from wanting to stand like a ballerina ... they arrived on time and part of her Halloween costume- cute
customer_reviews.author: Key West Mama

customer_reviews.title: Fit and Quality are great
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect and arrived nicely packaged. They fit a little big but there is a string to tighten and will fit snug. There is room to grow without sacrificing my little ones safety.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Auberguste

customer_reviews.title: Great ballet slippers
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for my little girl who just started taking her first dance class. The elastic allows for a comfortably tight fit around her feet. I feel they're a little small compared to her normal shoe size, but I'm new to buying ballet slippers, so this maybe normal? Either way, she loves them and dances around in them constantly and they've held up well!
customer_reviews.author: Eliza

customer_reviews.title: but I actually measured her foot to buy her soft shoes for Irish dance practice - it seems like this style runs small in any brand
customer_reviews.text: My daughter normally wears a size 11 in shoes, but I actually measured her foot to buy her soft shoes for Irish dance practice - it seems like this style runs small in any brand. She fits in the size 12 perfectly. For the price these are great, because when she hits that inevitable growth spurt it's no big thing to get another pair. She had no complaints about the fit or comfort either.
customer_reviews.author: mominatrixx

customer_reviews.title: So here's the deal... I bought these ...
customer_reviews.text: So here's the deal...I bought these shoes according to many of the other reviews which said that the shoes were a couple of sizes too small. My daughter wears a 10. All that was available was the thirteen, so I figured a size too big would be okay. Her feet were swimming in them. I would say go one size larger because they were about two sizes too big. The shoes seem to be very well made. I would purchase again, only just one size bigger.
customer_reviews.author: kman

customer_reviews.title: Made of cloth
customer_reviews.text: While the slippers fit as expected, I was slightly disappointed to receive them made of cloth, and not the usual ballerina finish. I would not recommend walking on wet pavement from a vehicle to class. However, if they hold up for a total of 4 months, (about 6 weeks into classes now) they would be considered money well spent. We plan to carry our ballerina into class if the ground is wet! She’s just four!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect slippers
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful little ballet slippers! They came exactly as pictured and very nice quality as far as how they are made. I can tell they will last long after my daughter outgrows them. I also love the pink color of these better than other slippers I have seen. I will be ordering the next sizes up as my daughter needs them! Plus, they are $7.50 cheaper than buying at PayLess!
customer_reviews.author: ColaCrock

customer_reviews.title: Canvas ballet shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are actually canvas ballet shoes, I did not realize that when ordering, my daughter did not seem to notice however and from the research I did online, many ballerinas actually prefer canvas to leather. If the studio allows them. So we will see how they do . So far so good
customer_reviews.author: Rukind

customer_reviews.title: Perfect ballet slippers for my granddaughter who got them for ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect ballet slippers for my granddaughter who got them for her birthday. She could not take them off, she wanted to dance and dance in these perfect slippers. Thanks for making it happen, they were as advertised and the timing was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Catbird

customer_reviews.title: Excellent canvas slippers!
customer_reviews.text: Great slippers! I got the wide for foot swelling. If your child’s foot runs a bit wider, I recommend getting the wide. Slippers should fit snug without pain. Remember their foot will swell (depending on the lessons; we take classical and they work the kids and my child needed the extra room for comfort). Fits true to size for my child
customer_reviews.author: The_Koo

customer_reviews.title: so per the reviews I bought an 8 and they are perfect. I love the x strap too
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wears a 7, so per the reviews I bought an 8 and they are perfect. I love the x strap too!
customer_reviews.author: Fanna Nicole Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: It was the right size. I ordered one size bigger, and its seems one size bigger. They don't fall off my daughter's feet though. She said they are comfortable. I like that I can adjust the tightness. Great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: laszlovna

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes, but beware dried glue in heel
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 4 year old daughter for her first dance class. They fit very well and we were very happy with them at first. After a few times wearing them my daughter told me the bottom of her heel hurt. I inspected them to find that hot glue had been used during the manufacturing to attach the heel padding to the shoe. The way it dried was like a stone was stuck in her shoe. I took the shoe apart, scrapped off the glue, sewed them back up, and now they work great again. The hard chunk of glue was the same on both shoes, so I don't feel like it was a fluke with one shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Zemple

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I had bought these in a smaller size for my daughter so naturally when she needed the next size up I ordered these again. The original pair fit her wide feet well and were easier to clean than the leather kind. Out of the box and plastic wrap brand new, one of the criss cross straps was already dangling and unattached on one side, never even worn and already broken. So disappointing. Sigh. The hunt for ballet shoes for wide toddler feet continues on.
customer_reviews.author: Dana M

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit and quality
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are VERY wide and came with no laces leaving very little to keep these shoes properly in place. The bottom pads are sewn straight up through the insoles, which would likely be uncomfortable but other than a small strip of adhesive, it’s the only thing keeping the insole attached to the shoe. There is no stretch anywhere in the canvas which could make for a very uncomfortable ballet class. I suppose if you had a wide-footed dancer who is just trying out a ballet class, this might suffice. But for a dancer with a little bit of experience who requires a little more from their shoe, this one falls short.
customer_reviews.author: Junemommy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, RUNS SMALL!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a toddler size 9 since that is what my daughter wears...well, apparently ballet slippers run REALLY small! I couldn't even get it on her foot. Had to borrow some other slippers in a bigger size and they're still tight. I was very disappointed in the size. Otherwise, these seemed of good quality and looked well made.
customer_reviews.author: JenS

customer_reviews.title: Beware the Stretchy String!
customer_reviews.text: I want to start by saying I love these shoes. They are perfect for our beginner ballet class. I went a size up as other reviewers suggested and they fit perfectly. However, there is a little stretchy string to tighten the shoe around your child's foot. Don't let them pull it out accidentally. It's a pain in the butt to re-string. If this happens to you, you can get a paper clip, unfold it, tie one end of the string on and then thread it through. Simple enough, but annoying. I am keeping their shoes double knotted from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Emm Max

customer_reviews.title: Overall nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Read other reviews to know they fit somewhat small and to get a size up. My daughter wears an 8T and I got her the 9T and they fit perfectly. Please tie the elastic string pulls. I didn't and one pulled out of the shoe with zero hopes in ever getting it back in. I bought these for dress up shoes for my daughter when she wears her ballerina outfits, and they serve that purpose well.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra M.

customer_reviews.title: Absolute rubbish!
customer_reviews.text: Came in like someone took material and threw it into the shape of a shoe. I always get capizio shoes because of the quality. These are crazy wide, in no way stiff. Like normal shirt material just hanging there. In no way a ballet shoe. Utterly appalled someone could try and sell this as a ballet shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha S.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product.
customer_reviews.text: I continually purchase this product for my 8 year old granddaughter. She is a fidgety little girl and runs a lot in the house. I have found that I cannot stop her from running, I can get her great traction slippers. And that's what our family has been using these ballet slippers for. She's never taken ballet. These are great for just on the deck. I usually purchase 2 different colors for both inside and out. She's been wearing these for a few years now, so I probably have purchased 10 - 12 pairs. Never been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: donna

customer_reviews.title: ORDER NORMAL SIZE
customer_reviews.text: I followed the reviews and ordered two sizes up for my three year old. WRONG! She wears a size 8 in Stride Rite so I ordered her a 10. Those were huge so I ordered a 9, also huge. I ended up ordering an 8 and returning the 10s but will hold onto the 9s because she wore them to class today. A tad slippery because the suede like material isn't that great. But for $12, they'll do. It's not like she's training for the New York Ballet, we're just in "Princess Dance" ;)
customer_reviews.author: CrunchyFamilyof5

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe, but don’t let your kid pull out the ribbon
customer_reviews.text: These simple slippers are great for a little dancer. My only complaint is that my daughter immediately pulled on the elastic ribbon that cinches shut the opening and forms the bow at the toe. She pulled it out of the slit that holds it and it is impossible to get back in, and now there is no way to tighten the shoe. I recommend sewing or flying that ribbon down immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie

customer_reviews.title: Fits wide feet, doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: Fits wide feet. They do not last long. They easily develop holes in the toes and heels. My kid wore them for a maximum of an hour once a week and her first pair wore out in less than a year. We just bought this again. hopefully this set lasts longer. These are the only thing we can find that work as dress shoes for my kiddo with extra wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: L. Garner

customer_reviews.title: so disappointed
customer_reviews.text: OK. I was super disappointed with this purchase. I ordered them for my daughters dance camp. They came in. Very bad quality and bad fit. I still need to return them. But they almost put me in a jam. I ended up having to re-order another one from another company. This is so disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Nicole McOmber

customer_reviews.title: Better Quality Available
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are not great quality. I found better ones on Amazon that were so much better. Besides that, one of the shoes was defective. Inside the shoe, the top part was glued down to the bottom. A foot never would’ve been able to go into it. I tried to carefully pull it loose and that created a defect on the outside. Wouldn’t recommend these at all.
customer_reviews.author: Pattie r.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: These are terrible. There’s no shape or support they are more like slippers but they stain easy and the fabric stretches out. There is no built in arch as the photo depicts. They flatten like pancakes with no shape.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole (Gerardi) Ermis

customer_reviews.title: Shoes run true to size or slightly big
customer_reviews.text: Before ordering I read reviews and measured my daughters foot. My daughter wears a 9.5-10 in street shoes. Shoes from the studio she dances with she was wearing a size 12. Based on foot measurements I ordered a size 12 little kids. It was to big. So I Than ordered a size 11 little kids. It is still too big. So I would recommend to anyone ordering, order your child’s street shoe size!
customer_reviews.author: jobberwocky

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: These little shoes are wonderful! While my 3 year old has not started dance yet, she was excited to get the shoes to practice around the house. They seem to be comfortable, she wears them all the time in the house and even sleeps in them. I was going to get her a size 9, since she usually wears an 8, but the reviews said to measure first. I'm glad I did, the 9 would have been huge. Make sure to measure their feet first to get the right size! At this price you don't have to worry about growth room, just get a couple sizes for growing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good price, I like how you can adjust them
customer_reviews.text: Good price, I like how you can adjust them. However, there was a frayed string on the bottom of the shoe that will likely come undone. The inside of the shoe would irritate any kid with sensory issues. So, I'd say good for dress-up or a child who is just trying out ballet and you aren't sure if it will stick.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Busby

customer_reviews.title: Material is cheap
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the product description, reviews, and pictures. The shoes are made out of a fabric similar to what reusable grocery bags are made out of - which is not at all what I (or my daughter) expect in a dance shoe. We kept the shoes because we were in a time pinch, but I would warn others to look for a shoe made of a better quality material.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Momma

customer_reviews.title: Slippery and thin
customer_reviews.text: My daughter can’t wear these around the house because she falls constantly. No gripping and very slippery. They’re also poorly made compared to ones we have purchased elsewhere at a similar price point.
customer_reviews.author: Eckert

customer_reviews.title: Good but measure carefully and consider ordering a size up.
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars for the "right" size. Size 8 is huge on my daughter in street shoes so I thought she would have a tiny bit to grow but they were way snugger than socks. I danced for several years and know how ballet shoes are supposed to fit. I returned with the Amazon free returns feature though and bought the size 9. Size 9 give her a little room to grow but fit well because the elastics hit at the perfect place. I'm glad these were already sewn in, many of the shoes I've purchased I've had to put the elastic in.
customer_reviews.author: A Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Great Ballet Shoes
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has used these ballet shoes exclusively since starting dance a couple of years ago. We have managed 1 pair per year (her feet don’t grow very quickly) and the quality of the shoe by the time recital rolls around is still excellent. Note: do not wear canvas ballet shoes on the street or they will stain. With proper care, these will still look great with months of use.
customer_reviews.author: CMArnold

customer_reviews.title: Sending these back!
customer_reviews.text: Really strange fit on both of my daughters. Very baggy in the forefoot, and they have wide feet. The pleats are not sewn down smoothly, and the leather split soles are so thick, that you can feel lumpiness under the ball of the foot while in releve. Not well constructed or professional looking at all. Way too baggy. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy Kay

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: The material is separating from the sole already and she's only danced one class in these. I contemplated sending them back but I suspect a replacement pair will be the same. I'm going to cut my losses and go to the way over priced dance store we bought her jazz shoes at. They held up wonderfully. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not like photo
customer_reviews.text: I always think bc of the photo (I’ve done this twice now) that I’m going to receive a ballet slipper that is more like leather than cloth.. I’m sure it’s my own oversight, but I look at the photo and think “leather-like” material rather than cloth. They will work, but my daughter doesn’t love them as much as she would have 🤦🏼‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Kayt de Hoyos

customer_reviews.title: falls apart quickly
customer_reviews.text: Started ripping after second *gentle*, indoor wear. This is a six year old and I put the shoes on her only in the studio. I'm not expecting professional quality, but they should hold up to more than two gentle uses.
customer_reviews.author: Crowells

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy, not good for dance class
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of these. They are not the typical material ballet shoes are. They are more of a cloth or towel like material. They get dirty really easy. My daughter wore them in the dance studio once and got real messed up. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Vega

customer_reviews.title: These are actually pretty nice for the price $11
customer_reviews.text: These are actually pretty nice for the price $11.79 not bad at all. definitely order a size up unless you want them to grow out of them in a month because ballet shoes run small anyways . reason I gave a 4 star is because they could have more cushion. my daughters wear a size 12 and 10 and I ordered them a 13 and 11 and they fit perfect with a little extra room to grow
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe. Very pink
customer_reviews.text: Good fit. My only complaint was that they were a much brighter pink than I was expecting. My daughters old shoes were capezios and they are a very light pink so I was hoping to get a pair along those lines. Great for the price though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Straps were too tight, shoes too big
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wears either a 13 or 1, so I bought the size one. The shoes were too big for her foot, but the straps were too tight and left marks on her little foot. I ended up buying the Capezio and should have done that from the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: DiscerningShopper

customer_reviews.title: Just as we expected
customer_reviews.text: These dance shoes are perfect for my 4.5 year old daughter. She is just starting out with dance, so we didn't want to spend a fortune on dance shoes. These seem to fit well and are fairly comfortable. We had previously bought her shoe size, but discovered they were a bit snug. These fit much better. I'm not sure if that's true for most, but definitely look into sizing before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: C. Colbert

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: After the first day of using at ballet class this huge "lump" came up under the heal part of it that we couldn't get to. My daughter danced on this lump for over an hour, then came out upset and with a hurt foot after class. Used once and now the are garbage.
customer_reviews.author: PNWmama

customer_reviews.title: Not at all comfortable on my granddaughter
customer_reviews.text: Not at all comfortable on my granddaughter. She won't wear them as they cause skin breakdown after only one hour. They are the right size. It's just how they are constructed, I guess. The painful part is in the back at the top of her heel.
customer_reviews.author: Judy A. Whitworth

customer_reviews.title: I think that if I just would have purchased a size close to what she normally wears instead of assuming they run small it would have worked out better for us
customer_reviews.text: I should have paid more attention to sizing instead of getting the size that she wore in a different brand. They were made of a fabric instead of leather, which I must have just assumed they would be made of based on other ballet shoes we have purchased. I think that if I just would have purchased a size close to what she normally wears instead of assuming they run small it would have worked out better for us. Other than my own mistakes being made they were well made and very adjustable which was something I thought was nice.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Myers

customer_reviews.title: Quality as expected but size up.
customer_reviews.text: These are as expected except for the size. I followed the measurements but they’re still tight. I will need to order a size up. I don’t mind waiting for the exchange, but don’t like that I won’t get a full refund on these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weird thin canvas fabric, to small
customer_reviews.text: my daughter is a 5.5. I've ordered size 6 from stelle in other ballet shoes and they fit great. These though are to small. Also. Its a weird canvas feeling fabric thats super thin.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Lizarraga

customer_reviews.title: These are not ballet pink.
customer_reviews.text: This is not ballet pink. She needs to wear ballet pink for her recital and I now have to buy a new pair because these are just plain pink and stick out compared to all the other kids who are wearing actual ballet pink. They also run very large and do not offer the usual support of ballet slippers.
customer_reviews.author: Anna S

customer_reviews.title: A good show for a fledgling wannabe ballerina.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I gave these to our six year old granddaughter. She didn't take them off for almost three hours. She absolutely loves them! She puts the Nutcracker Suite on and dances all around the living room. They seem to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Order one size up
customer_reviews.text: Super cute and made of good quality canvas (as far as I can tell so far.) The elastic in the front (which had already given me trouble with tying) was pulled out within 12 hours by my 3 year old which was irritating but doesn’t effect the shoes. My daughter wears size 7 toddler but we ordered the size 8 based on reviews and they fit perfect like a glove.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Crap product! Don’t spend your money on this!
customer_reviews.text: Bottom of shoe has fallen through! Not a good thing when your kid has a show!
customer_reviews.author: Oluwajoba Taiwo

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: Size is accurate and I like the double straps but the product was defective. I attached a picture to show the issue. The straps are attached so the lip/rim of the shoe turns out when wearing, rather than laying flat against her foot, as shown in the manufacturer photo. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: jmm

customer_reviews.title: Ballet Slippers-- they work
customer_reviews.text: For the smaller sizes, (especially) might be good to secure the stretch tie that tightens the fit with a stitch at the middle/center top of foot. Kids do not understand that once they pull the tie all the way through (and out) it is very hard to get back through the tiny casing.
customer_reviews.author: KAPAtl

customer_reviews.title: They are not like the standard ballet shoes made of leather
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you note that they are canvas material and the bottom has 2 paddings. They are not like the standard ballet shoes made of leather. And make sure you note that the return period is shorter than the normal 3mths from amazon. I got 2 pairs to try on my daughter and missed the return period =(
customer_reviews.author: KndT

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. Very cute. My daughter loves it and she’s a beginner. The cloth is thick and forms well in my daughter’s foot. Will buy again from them when my daughter outgrew them.
customer_reviews.author: rechia laus

customer_reviews.title: Poor heel
customer_reviews.text: Top and front are nice and pretty and material is thick as you’d expect but the back doesn’t come up your heel and just flaps around. Imagine the heel to your shoe being half its length. We sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: TL150

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: The string was coming apart on the top. The elastic was torn and about to break if I tied it in a bow
customer_reviews.author: HarlowsMama

customer_reviews.title: LACES ALWAYS COME UNDONE
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought 3 of these shoes already. IM DONE! Laces keep falling out and make them unwearable. If you want to get furious and loose money these are the ballet shoes to buy
customer_reviews.author: Sarah L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for dressup
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my daughter and they are not the BEST quality but still very good. They fit a bit loose but the strings help tighten the shoe. My daughter will grow into them so its not an issue. The soles are not the best and get worn very quickly, but its to be expected. Overall they are good for the price
customer_reviews.author: Alecan2

customer_reviews.title: Seems to run small
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a 5 and a 6 with the intention of returning the one that didn't fit. However, neither fit (both too small) and seemed to actually have not much difference at all. Also, it was hard to tell which one was the for the right foot and which was for the left foot. My daughter is 2.5 and wears a size 5 toddler.
customer_reviews.author: smh06

customer_reviews.title: Looks like no one cares
customer_reviews.text: Just not very well made. I know these are canvas, not leather, but they just look and feel so cheap compared to the leather version sold by the same company. It looks like no one cared when they made these.
customer_reviews.author: lilyholic

customer_reviews.title: don't look like they'd hold up very long
customer_reviews.text: Awful, returned these. WAY SMALLER than size stated. And even if they had fit, they were thin and cheap canvas, don't look like they'd hold up very long. We ordered a size 5t and they fit more like a 4t.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rough fabric
customer_reviews.text: Rough fabric ... hard to get used to... hard to put on for a child when new
customer_reviews.author: mombear

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought two pairs of these slippers. Three strings broke within three dance classes. Three out of four slippers broke. Poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: michael clinkscales

customer_reviews.title: Great for temporary solution
customer_reviews.text: I was in need of dance slippers for an upcoming photo and saw that these were a great price. The shoes arrived within the correct time frame; however, they are a little tight and are made out of light canvas material. The slipper was great for pictures, but would not hold up for an entire dance semester.
customer_reviews.author: Mississippi girl

customer_reviews.title: Buy 2 sizes up!
customer_reviews.text: This ballet slipper is not comparable to regular shoe size. My daughter wears a size 8 shoe, so I bought size 8 ballet slippers- they were way too small. I bought a second pair of ballet slippers in a size 10. The size 10 fit. This is our first time doing ballet, her instructor told me ballet slippers typically run about 2 sizes too small. (Hope this helps someone else as I had no idea)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Returned it. Liked the leather ones better. Seemed like the quality wouldn’t hold up and I didn’t want to chance it since they were for a toddler.
customer_reviews.author: kfaul

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL - ZERO STARS
customer_reviews.text: I ordered them on March 19 because i bought them in the past and they were good material, but this time they arrived on March 22 and today, as you can see in the picture, they are ruined!!! Just 2 months later!!! So disappointed because I cannot even return them.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Harvey

customer_reviews.title: These are just right.
customer_reviews.text: The color is light pastel pink and perfect. The canvas slippers are the best. These fit well and grip well too. Top marks and highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: E!

customer_reviews.title: Total junk
customer_reviews.text: Total crap. You might as well tie a piece of fabric around your kids feet. I’m super disappointed. I thought I was getting a good deal but I really just paid for something that is going straight to the trash. There is no possible way she can use these for ballet class. They are literally just a piece of fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Kellyanndrake

customer_reviews.title: It's great and slightly adjustable!
customer_reviews.text: So I know nothing about ballet but I just put my daughter in ballet and we got her these shoes and she loves them. Or she's at least enjoying the class. I like that you can pull the shoes tight so even if the shoes are a bit big, you can adjust them as needed!
customer_reviews.author: freelinerunner

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Slipper does it’s job, I’m just disappointed when the shoe that arrived didn’t match the images on the ad. The ad shows a crisscross strap, the shoe that came only has one strap across.
customer_reviews.author: Shoe Lover

customer_reviews.title: I would buy from this brand again.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice beginner ballet flat. The shoe size ran a little large, but that wasn't too big of a problem because you can tighten the shoe. I guess that leaves room for her to grow. :) They must be comfortable, because my daughter normally tries to take off any shoe that is on her foot, but she doesn't mind these ones.
customer_reviews.author: brett hampton

customer_reviews.title: Would not reccommend.  They fall apart easily!
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and buy leather ones! These fell apart after the 2nd class use. The canvas unthreaded on the top by where the drawstrings are.
customer_reviews.author: JacquieT

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable dance shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought for 2 granddaughters; one needs a wide toe area and one has very narrow feet. These were able to accommodate both
customer_reviews.author: Pamela J. Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for mini ballerinas
customer_reviews.text: These ballet slippers are perfect when they are young and you need a new pair every 6mo-1yr because they grow out of them. We have bought 2 pairs now and they still look great! Easy to wash as well which is always a plus.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly cook

customer_reviews.title: Cute but not a lot of traction for the little ones.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter slips alot wearing these compared to the ones we bought at a local store. They are cute but im scared she will hurt herself while in class.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fit small.
customer_reviews.text: Fits at least a size small. My daughter just got into size 7 shoes. I purchased a size 8 and they are TIGHT! Love the look and quality, just too small.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Ross

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughter loved these
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a 4 yr old and she wears them all the time in the house dancing around. She was ecstatic when they arrived, and everything the sellers advertises is true.
customer_reviews.author: Mammy Rho

customer_reviews.title: Beginners ballet shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Granddaughter loves pink and has just started dance. I didn't want to spend a bunch of money if she decides she doesn't want to continue with dance. These are well made and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Narrow fit
customer_reviews.text: They’re not wide or stretchy enough for chubby toddler feet. She loves them but cannot wear them without pinching her feet and cutting off circulation.
customer_reviews.author: BellaK

customer_reviews.title: Well made ballet shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made ballet shoe, my daughter loves them and they were truely the smallest ones we could find for her tiny feet. We will be purchasing these again when we need the next size up.
customer_reviews.author: Nini R

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: I followed the measurements but they are way too big for my toddler. I kept them for when she sizes out of the ones I ended up buying from her dance school.
customer_reviews.author: charity hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These were a replacement in a crunch. My daughter likes them more than her pricey slippers. Will buy again when she outgrows these.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Alcina

customer_reviews.title: Be careful of size chart
customer_reviews.text: I went by the size chart provided and these came back like 3 sizes too small. My daughter is an 8.5 shoe right now. I ordered the 7.5 and they were tiny. Luckily amazon makes the return process so easy. Otherwise I'm sure the product would've been great.
customer_reviews.author: Carlo

customer_reviews.title: Laces keep coming out
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately we couldn't use these, the laces kept coming untied and coming out while she was dancing. We tried to get the laces threaded back though, and keep them back in - that worked once and took 90 minutes. They came out at her next dance class. The slippers are loose and useless without the laces to tighten them around the foot. very disappointed, with a very disappointed little girl.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Eustis

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, issue with staying tied
customer_reviews.text: Like the softness of the fabric. The little elastic ties will not stay tied, but other than that it is a great little ballet shoe.
customer_reviews.author: D. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Quality! The shoes are made well and come in a very nice case. My four year old granddaughter received these for Christmas as she thinks she is a ballerina and she loves them. Suggest you order a size up as although they do fit, her toes are right at the top.
customer_reviews.author: shirley jensen

customer_reviews.title: Not good at all
customer_reviews.text: I didn't even have my daughter wear these and wish we hadn't been in the middle of moving so I would have remembered to return them. They are made out of thin material. Like the material that dust bags are made out of. I should have known with the price I was just trying to find something to work for her last class since we couldn't find her other ones. Ended up borrowing from a friend. DONT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Lee Parks

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe for the price
customer_reviews.text: These were a little loose but we tightened them with the bow. She’ll grow into them granddaughter loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small fit, stiff canvas.
customer_reviews.text: Fit small and canvas is so tight there’s no wiggle room. The canvas is stiff, my daughter’s last pair of canvas shoes were so flexible and fit comfortable (amazon didn’t carry the brand, so we tried these).
customer_reviews.author: Christina Agoris

customer_reviews.title: Did not meet expectations
customer_reviews.text: These ballet shoes did not quite look the same as the listing. My first impression was that they looked cheap. They fit my daughter much larger than size.
customer_reviews.author: Shan

customer_reviews.title: Not the best option
customer_reviews.text: The canvas isn’t the best option very tough material. Not a huge issue for a beginner but traditional ballet slippers are best and not priced much different. Only used them once before I bought regular slippers now she plays in the at home.
customer_reviews.author: Tadzia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect for my toddler’s ballet class. I’ve bought two pair - as her feet grow - and will continue to buy this brand. They don’t wear easily. We’re already on the next size up and the original pair look good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Not the best ballet slipper...
customer_reviews.text: I've learned these ballet slippers run small! My girls are able to squeeze their feet in, but end up taking them off half way through their dance class. The strings have fallen out of both of them. However, they are washable and do come out nice and clean. If I am to order again, will definitely order one size bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Smasal

customer_reviews.title: Blemished shoe
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are functionally and practically fine, but the pair I received had a small red stain on the straps. Its on the inside of the ankle, and doesn't effect the actual use of the product. If these weren't needed for an eminent dance class, I would return them, but for now I'll just be glad the stain isn't highly visible.
customer_reviews.author: Mile High Moon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect match
customer_reviews.text: We both these shoes to match our granddaughters ballerina dress it was a perfect fit and match. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Frances E Wilson

product_meta.title: STELLE Girls Canvas Ballet Slipper/Ballet Shoe/Yoga Dance Shoe (Toddler/Little Kid/Big Kid/Women/Boy)
feature_bullets: STELLE ballet shoes for girls: suede sole
20 years of experience in professional dance/ballet shoes making
Lightweight slippers to let your feet breath. Very comfortable. Recommended by professional ballet instructors.
Canvas upper: Premium materials: our shoes are made of washable high quality,light weighted canvas materials

Refer to the shoe size chart in images for proper sizing. Dance shoes are supposed to fit close to the foot, they aren't supposed to fit like regular street shoes. Based on passed customer reviews, please order one size up.

For kids younger than 5 years old, please order Toddler 5M Toddler to 10M Toddler; For kids between 5 and 10 years old, please order Little Kid 11M to Big Kid 3M; For kids older than 10 years old/Women, please order Big Kid 4M to Big Kid 10M. Big kid size is the same as women's size.
